main_definition: Surprise is an unexpected event or situation that evokes a sense of astonishment, amazement, or sudden emotional reaction.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An unexpected event causing wonder or alarm
meanings_and_examples.example: I was completely taken by surprise when my friends threw me a surprise birthday party.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Feeling of astonishment aroused by something unexpectedly good or pleasant
meanings_and_examples.example: Her smile was genuine, it surprised everyone and brightened up the room instantly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A sudden event that happens without warning, often with positive connotations
meanings_and_examples.example: The arrival of snow in July came as a pleasant surprise to the townspeople who had been expecting summer all along.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An unexpected gift or gesture meant to delight someone
meanings_and_examples.example: The couple's anniversary was made even more special with their friends' thoughtful and surprising gift.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A feeling of shock, disbelief, or bewilderment caused by an unforeseen occurrence
meanings_and_examples.example: When she found out about the lottery win, she was in complete surprise and couldn't believe her luck.
